dt: {bc}a bronze-colored European freshwater cyprinid fish ({it}Abramis brama{/it})
{bc}any of various marine fish (family Sparidae) related to the porgy
{bc}any of various freshwater sunfishes ({it}Lepomis{/it} and related genera)

et: Middle English {it}breme{/it}, from Anglo-French, of Germanic origin; akin to Old High German {it}brahsima{/it} bream, Middle High German {it}brehen{/it} to shine
shortdef: a bronze-colored European freshwater cyprinid fish (Abramis brama); broadly : any of various related fishes
any of various marine fish (family Sparidae) related to the porgy —called also sea bream
any of various freshwater sunfishes (Lepomis and related genera); especially : bluegill

dt: {bc}to clean (a ship's bottom) by heating and scraping

et: probably from Dutch {it}brem{/it} furze; from the use of burning furze in the cleaning
shortdef: to clean (a ship's bottom) by heating and scraping

dt: {bc}a bird (such as a robin) with a reddish breast
{bc}a reddish-bellied sunfish ({it}Lepomis auritus{/it}) of the eastern U.S.

shortdef: a bird (such as a robin) with a reddish breast
a reddish-bellied sunfish (Lepomis auritus) of the eastern U.S. —called also red-breasted bream
